data.Title: Contract K1434-14C Station Improvement Works at KOT
data.ProjectName: Contract K1434-14C Station Improvement Works at KOT

children.text: This is a station improvement project located at one of the busiest stations – the Kowloon Tong Station, the interchange station of East Rail Line and Kwun Tong Line. All the works were carried out with minimal disruptions to the operating station. To achieve this, the project team implemented comprehensive logistic arrangement and detailed planning of work. We are proud that the works in the operating station were completed without causing any major nuisance and disturbance to the public.

data.Title: Harbour Area Treatment Scheme Stage 2A – Upgrading of Preliminary Treatment Works at North Point, Wan Chai East and Central (Contract No. DC/2009/23)
data.ProjectName: Harbour Area Treatment Scheme Stage 2A – Upgrading of Preliminary Treatment Works at North Point, Wan Chai East and Central

children.text: Harbour Area Treatment Scheme  is being implemented in stages to combat water pollution caused by urban development around Victoria Harbour.

This is one of the Harbour Area Treatment Scheme projects, and its major works includes the construction of fine screen and grit trap buildings, deodorization rooms, administration building and modification of existing inlet pumping stations at the preliminary treatment works at North Point, Wan Chai East and Central.

data.Title: Addition and Alteration to station facilities at Hung Hom Station (Contract No. KA W835)
data.ProjectName: Addition and Alteration to station facilities at Hung Hom Station

children.text: The major scope of this project is to modify the existing Hung Hom Station to cater for the operation of Kowloon Southern Link. The works consist of :
Demolition of existing staircase, plant rooms and lift shaft
Modification of existing plant rooms
Reconfiguration of new 4 numbers of escalator control room (ECR).
Replacement / Provision of platform ceiling with lighting enhancement
Replace / Provide new signage including supply and install new platform header board sign along the platforms.
Construct new generator room
Fitting-out works

data.Title: Admiralty Integrated Station and SCL Enabling Works (South Island Line (East) – Contract 901)
data.ProjectName: Admiralty Integrated Station and SCL Enabling Works

children.text: The South Island Line (East) is a medium-capacity railway connecting the MTR network at Admiralty to the Southern District of Hong Kong, via new stations at Ocean Park, Wong Chuk Hang, Lei Tung and South Horizons - a distance of approximately 7 km.

The primary objective of Contract 901 is to construct a new Admiralty Integrated Station in an urban centre with a very limited site area.  Under this contract, the existing Admiralty Station will be significantly extended to provide interchange facilities between the existing Tsuen Wan Line, the new South Island Line (East) and the proposed Shatin to Central Link. In addition to the four new platforms to be constructed below and adjacent to the existing station, the works include an interchange concourse, relocation of existing passenger entrances and external landscaping.

The Works under MTR Contract 901 comprise an extension east of the existing ADM station. The ADM integrated station will accommodate an interchange concourse, circulation areas and station cavern for SIL and SCL (Shatin Central Link). The extension is located under Harcourt Garden and is bounded by the existing ADM station, two existing finger platform box structures (Island Line and Tsuen Wan Line) and the existing underground Admiralty car park. The proposed platforms for SIL(E) and SCL will be constructed below and adjacent to the existing ADM.

data.Title: Construction and Fitting Out of Integrated Airport Centre (Contract M991)
data.ProjectName: Construction and Fitting Out of Integrated Airport Centre

children.text: The works include the construction, fitting out and maintenance of the Integrated Airport Centre

data.Title: Conversion of the Secondary Pool of the Lai Chi Kok Park Swimming Pool into an Indoor Heated Pool (Contract No. AL W316)
data.ProjectName: Conversion of the Secondary Pool of the Lai Chi Kok Park Swimming Pool into an Indoor Heated Pool

children.text: Hong Kong Government proposed to build an indoor heated swimming pool, which would have the effect of promoting swimming in winter and better health amongst the residents in the district, and thus enhancing the overall usage of the swimming pool.

The project includes the provision of a light cover and retractable sidewalls for the secondary pool; a new heating system to the secondary pool and a covered-walkway; demolition of the existing children's fun pool and associated improvements to ventilation and hot water systems in changing room.

data.Title: Main Contract for Package 1 – Façade upgrade at ATL Logistics Centre, Berth 3, Kwai Chung, New Territories
data.ProjectName: Main Contract for Package 1 – Façade upgrade at ATL Logistics Centre, Berth 3, Kwai Chung, New Territories
data.Client: ATL Logistics Centre Hong Kong Limited

children.text: ATL Logistics Centre, strategically located at the heart of Kwai Chung Container Terminals, is the world's first and largest intelligent multi-storey drive-in cargo logistics centre and provides a comprehensive range of logistics services in Hong Kong.

ATL decided to upgrade the existing façade with new features at Logistics Centre at Block A and B to complement its future business development. The scope of work under this Main Contract comprised of demolition of existing logos, installation of new signage and LED light strip, façade repairing, external wall paint and gondola improvement works.

Construction safety is always one of our top priorities. As the majority of works under this contract involved the external wall of the building, safety became a particularly important concern for us and was the most challenging mission during the construction period. Apart from safety issues, the project team also worked closely with ATL to minimize the disturbance to their 24 hours operation through carefully planned project management on daily operation, material delivery, implementation of Temporary Traffic Arrangements scheme and access control during the construction stage.

data.Title: MTR Contract No. Q036895 - Maritime Square Extension Works
data.ProjectName: MTR Contract No. Q036895 - Maritime Square Extension Works

children.text: The extension works' objective was to upgrade the entertainment facilities for residents to enjoy and also enhance its attractiveness as a tourist spot for visitors. It also serves as a pedestrian transport hub connecting the surrounding residential estates, MTR and public transport interchange with bridges and an all-day walkway.

The major scope of this project consisted of modification of the existing public lorry park into a 5-storey commercial complex (including a mezzanine floor). The works included the construction of superstructure works with landscape desk, implementation of Temporary Traffic Arrange (TTA) to maintain Public Transport Interchange (PTI) operation. The majority of the structural  with A&A works and internal and external works would take 25 months to complete.

data.Title: MTR Lai Chi Kok Station, Cheung Lai Street Pedestrian Subway and Entrance Work
data.ProjectName: MTR Lai Chi Kok Station, Cheung Lai Street Pedestrian Subway and Entrance Work
data.Client: Iconic Palace Ltd., Solar Kingdom Ltd. & Dragon Beauty International Ltd.

children.text: This project involves the construction of a pedestrian subway connecting Liberté and The Pacifica and the existing Lai Chi Kok MTR station. The purpose of this project is to improve the accessibility to the Lai Chi Kok Station (LCK) to prepare for the future developments by providing MTRC passengers a more direct, convenient and comfortable access to the LCK station. With the West Kowloon Corridor being extended to the south, the subway will reduce above-grade pedestrian traffic and provide significant improvements to the environment and comfort of passengers accessing LCK station and people crossing Lai Chi Kok Road.

The major works consisted of the construction of a pedestrian subway connecting Liberté in Lot No. NKIL 6328 and The Pacifica in Lot No. NKIL 6275 to Lai Chi Kok MTR Station (approx. 250m long x 7m wide x 5.5m high) along Cheung Lai Street; construction of a 1800mm diameter sewer pipe diversion along the Lai Chi Kok Road; and diversion of an existing 400kV CLP cable along Cheung Lai Street.

data.Title: New Entrance and Concourse at University Station (Contract K0736-11C)
data.ProjectName: New Entrance and Concourse at University Station

children.text: Our group was awarded the improvement works of University Station, which mainly included the construction of a new station concourse with an area of 200m2 and entrance near the northern end of the uptrack platform, construction of a new covered walkway along uptrack platform, and design and build of an aluminium ceiling and monitor roof.

data.Title: Package Contract No. C84-0032 AOS Revitalization - Supply, Installation, Testing and Commissioning of Demolition and Re-Construction of Decking Package Contract
data.ProjectName: Package Contract No. C84-0032 AOS Revitalization - Supply, Installation, Testing and Commissioning of Demolition and Re-Construction of Decking Package Contract

children.text: The revitalization plan of Avenue of Stars (AOS) was announced in 2015 and the avenue was reopened in 2019.

The reconstruction of the deck structure along the avenue was one of the package contracts of the AOS revitalization project. The works include the demolition and reconstruction of the existing AOS deck structure, the reparation of existing crossheads and the installation of precast cladding panels. It also involves the demolition and reconstruction of the existing connecting bridge from AOS to Hotel InterContinental Hong Kong.

The AOS project was carried out under the spot lights of mass media. The major challenge facing by the project team is the short contract period. With an ambitious project timeframe, the demolition and reconstruction of around 400m long concrete bridge structure in marine condition is completed within 11 months. The project team is proud to successfully complete the project with high standard of project management in terms of public relation, quality assurance, programme monitoring, budget control, safety and environmental.

data.Title: Pre-construction Consultancy Agreement and A&A and improvement works for International Finance Centre & Apple Store
data.ProjectName: Pre-construction Consultancy Agreement and A&A and improvement works for International Finance Centre & Apple Store
data.Client: Apple Asia Limited International Finance Centre Management Co., Ltd.

children.text: In 2011, Apple opened its first store in Hong Kong, the Apple Store® ifc mall, the 100th branch outside the United States. Since January 2011, Build King had completed 3 contracts at the IFC mall. The 1st contract, employed by the Apple Asia Limited, involved the work to develop a detailed implementation plan in conjunction with the Authorised Person, registered engineers and engineering consultants for the approval from Building Department. The 2nd contract, employed by the International Finance Centre Management Co., Ltd, involved the work to undertake A&A and improvement works at the IFC shopping Mall and the 3rd contract, employed by the Apple Asia Limited, involved the work to combine 8 nos. of existing shops into one big store and to undertake the structural A&A works in the store which composed of the installation of a 3rd floor, the removal of part of the 2nd floor slab and reinforcement structure and the strengthening of the existing steel structure at the store.

data.Title: Refurbishment of Nursery Rooms at PTB (Contract M988)
data.ProjectName: Refurbishment of Nursery Rooms at PTB

children.text: The works consist of the Refurbishment of 16 nos. Nursery Rooms at levels 4, 5, 6 and 7 of the Passenger Terminal Buildings

data.Title: Refurbishment of Smoking Lounges at PTB (Contract M980)
data.ProjectName: Refurbishment of Smoking Lounges at PTB

children.text: Refurbishment works to 10 nos. of smoking lounges located at levels 5 and 6 of the Passenger Terminal Building (PTB)

data.Title: Replacement of Ceiling Panels at Main Concourse of Hung Hom Station (Contract No. K8012-08C)
data.ProjectName: Replacement of Ceiling Panels at Main Concourse of Hung Hom Station

data.Title: Reprovisioning of Harbour Road Sports Centre and Wan Chai Swimming Pool (Shatin to Central Link – Contract No. 1126)
data.ProjectName: Reprovisioning of Harbour Road Sports Centre and Wan Chai Swimming Pool

children.text: Shatin to Central Link (SCL) is a 17km-long railway line expansion undertaken by MTR Corporation in Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. The project involves stretching the line from Tai Wai to Hung Hom and Hung Hom to Admiralty sections, linking a number of existing railway lines passing through several districts in Hong Kong

The SCL Exhibition Station is located under the existing Wan Chai Ferry Pier Public Transport Interchange, Harbour Road Sports Centre (HRSC) and Wan Chai Swimming Pool (WCSP). As the station were to be constructed using the cut-and-cover method, the HRSC and WCSP had to be permanently relocated to the old public car park in the south. The existing facilities were demolished only after the reprovisioning work is completed.

The scope of the project comprised the construction of the new HRSC and WCSP, a 5-storey RC building with steel trussed roof. Associated with the new building, the scope is also included the design and construction of the external building envelope; design and construction of internal fabric and finishes, equipment and fittings; design and construction of building services works, including, among others, hoisting beams and support details, steelwork access platforms, electrical, ELV, filtration, ACMV, FS, lift & escalator, Town Gas and plumbing and drainage systems.

data.Title: Shatin to Central Link – Contract No. 1111 Hung Hom North Approach Tunnels
data.ProjectName: Shatin to Central Link – Contract No. 1111 Hung Hom North Approach Tunnels

children.text: The Shatin to Central Link (SCL) is a government funded concessionary project providing a strategic rail corridor from Shatin to Central. One of the contracts of the Shatin to Central Link (SCL). The scope of work is included Tunnels Works, Foundation Works, Site Formation Works, Bridge Works, Noise Enclosure Works and Demolition Works. This is a challenging project in terms of geographical location and work complexity, as this construction site will passes through the aged urban town Hung Hom where a huge amount of utilities are underground. Due to the location, extensive TTM arrangements and utilities diversion and/or protection has to be undertaken.

data.Title: Shatin to Central Link – Contract No.1106 Diamond Hill Station
data.ProjectName: Shatin to Central Link – Contract No.1106 Diamond Hill Station

children.text: The 17-kilometre SCL was a territory-wide strategic railway project involving 10 stations, amongst which Diamond Hill was one of the six interchange stations. Upon the completion of Diamond Hill Station, it will become a new interchange station for the future SCL and the existing Kwun Tong Line.

The scope of SCL1106 included construction of a new SCL concourse and platforms and a wide array of enhanced facilities including the installation of 3 new lifts, 12 escalators, additional ticket issuing machines, automatic teller machines, shops, and new public toilet facilities. The scope also include the relocation of heritage structures and archaeological diggings.

data.Title: St. Paul's Hospital Redevelopment - Demolition of Existing Old Block and Structures, Construction of a New Basement and Extension of Block A, Alteration and Addition Works to Block A, Block B and Basement D
data.ProjectName: St. Paul's Hospital Redevelopment - Demolition of Existing Old Block and Structures, Construction of a New Basement and Extension of Block A, Alteration and Addition Works to Block A, Block B and Basement D
data.Client: The Mother Superior of the Soeurs De Saint Paul De Chartres (Hong Kong)

children.text: St. Paul's Hospital was founded in 1898 by the Sisters of St. Paul de Chartres. Located in the heart of Causeway Bay, this comprehensive, acute private hospital provides around 500 beds across over 20 departments, with ongoing redevelopment to expand its facilities and diversify services.

This project involves the construction of a new basement and extension of Block A, alteration and addition works to Blocks A, B, and Basement D, conversion of an open car park to a landscaped garden, road widening and paving works at Eastern Hospital Road, and the demolition of an existing old block followed by the construction of a new basement structure and superstructure.

data.Title: The Chinese University of Hong Kong – New Chapel to Theology Building
data.ProjectName: The Chinese University of Hong Kong – New Chapel to Theology Building
data.Client: The Chinese University of Hong Kong

children.text: In order to provide a better environment for the student to have a devotional worship, The Chinese University of Hong Kong decided to build a new chapel.

Our group has awarded this New Chapel to Theology Building contract. The works consist of the construction of a 1,450 m2 chapel, where for accommodating 350 people. With its eastern style green glazed tiles roof, the new chapel assimilates into the natural environment. The round-shaped chapel is surrounded by windows to maximize natural light, it can save more energy and provide a nature view for the worship. The chapel also installed fourteen stained glass windows and is supported by 12 pillars with an emblem for one of the 12 disciples on each pillar.

data.Title: The Proposed Alteration and Addition Works for Little Dalton School at 1/F & 2/F Imperial Cullinan, No. 10 Hoi Fai Road, Tai Kok Tsui, Kowloon
data.ProjectName: The Proposed Alteration and Addition Works for Little Dalton School at 1/F & 2/F Imperial Cullinan, No. 10 Hoi Fai Road, Tai Kok Tsui, Kowloon

children.text: The Dalton School of Hong Kong is a non-profit bilingual (Mandarin, English) kindergarten and primary school that combines the wisdom of traditional Chinese culture with the world-renowned Dalton Education Program. The school aims to provide a joyful environment that will nurture children's inquisitiveness; develop their confidence in their ability to succeed; exploit their natural ability to acquire languages; and educate them to become happy, responsible and independent learners and thinkers.

The project involves demolition works of existing blockwall partition, installation of new blockwall, dry wall and glass partitions, timber door finishings, glass doors, painting works, brand new vinyl flooring and E&M installation works within a very tight construction timeline.

data.Title: Thrill Mountain & Polar Adventure (Ocean Park Master Redevelopment Project Contract No. CS03)
data.ProjectName: Thrill Mountain & Polar Adventure

children.text: Ocean Park's Master Redevelopment Plan included two new themed projects in "The Summit" area - "Thrill Mountain" and "Polar Adventure", covering a total area of 400,000 square feet.

"Thrill Mountain" offered six attractions, booth games, as well as food, beverages and merchandise, while "Polar Adventure" consists of "North Pole Encounter", "South Pole Spectacular" and "Arctic Blast ".

Several building materials used in the construction included fiberglass reinforced concrete for the manufacture of icebergs and imitation stones. In order to allow visitors to have the best underwater experience, the exhibition hall used transparent acrylic plates and transparent tempered glass of 202mm thickness for the construction of underwater tunnels and underwater screen. The newly opened restaurant also used transparent acrylic panel for the screen, allowing visitors to watch the Antarctic penguins while enjoying their food.

data.Title: Uplifting Works to Promenades of Aberdeen Harbour and Ap Lei Chau Main Street Area (Contract No. CV/2011/02)
data.ProjectName: Uplifting Works to Promenades of Aberdeen Harbour and Ap Lei Chau Main Street Area

children.text: This is a Design and Build project for the uplifting works to promenades of Aberdeen Harbour and Ap Lei Chau Main Street Area. The objective of the works is to enhance the Aberdeen area and aim to further bring out the unique features of 'traditional fishing harbour' and the local culture of Aberdeen and, by reinforcing the elements of diversified tourism, to enhance Aberdeen's attractiveness to both international visitors and local residents.

data.Title: Wan Chai Station Lee Tung Street Subway (Contract C6593-13C)
data.ProjectName: Wan Chai Station Lee Tung Street Subway

children.text: The project involved constructing a 100m new pedestrian subway extending from the existing MTR Wan Chai Station concourse, running under Southorn Playground and across Johnston Road to the basement of the redeveloped Urban Renewal Authority (URA), and to modify the existing facilities. The pedestrian subway provided direct, convenient, safe and comfortable access for pedestrians and MTR passengers for crossing Johnston Road. It enhanced the connectivity of pedestrian facilities between north and south Wan Chai. Cut and cover method was used for the construction of pedestrian subway, while temporary traffic arrangements were arranged at Johnston Road during the construction period to maintain the daily ongoing traffic including trams and vehicles. In addition, the project also included the improvement works for the Southorn Stadium, including resurfacing the basketball mat and replacing facilities etc.
